title: How to Add Your Own Game Startup Music in Team Fortress 2

steps.headline: Go onto My Computer, then select your hard disk drive's icon.
Click the Program Files folder, then the Steam folder.
Once you are at the Steam folder, navigate through this chain of folders.
steps.description: steamapps > common > Team Fortress 2 > tf > custom.

steps.headline: In the custom folder, create the following chain of folders: my_sounds > sound > ui.
In the ui folder, place the MP3s you'd like to have in the game.
Once the songs are placed in the folder, name them accordingly.
steps.description: You must name them as follows: "gamestartup1", "gamestartup2", and so on. The game will allow up to 19 start-up tracks, ending at "gamestartup19".

steps.headline: Congratulations!
steps.description: Once you have done this, the songs you chose will have been added to the list of game startup music!

text: Go onto My Computer, then select your hard disk drive's icon.  Click the Program Files folder, then the Steam folder.  Once you are at the Steam folder, navigate through this chain of folders. steamapps > common > Team Fortress 2 > tf > custom. In the custom folder, create the following chain of folders: my_sounds > sound > ui.  In the ui folder, place the MP3s you'd like to have in the game.  Once the songs are placed in the folder, name them accordingly. You must name them as follows: "gamestartup1", "gamestartup2", and so on. The game will allow up to 19 start-up tracks, ending at "gamestartup19". Congratulations! Once you have done this, the songs you chose will have been added to the list of game startup music!
